intro: Schmidelia glabra, commonly known as the smooth schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Schmidelia glabra is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
